attributes.action: Stop the buliding of new houses on green spaces in Bratton area!
attributes.additional_details: It will worsen traffic, overcrowd schools, and strain local services. Our precious green spaces will be lost, harming wildlife and removing vital recreational areas. Bratton’s rural character will vanish, replaced by urban sprawl. Nearby areas like Shawbirch and Allcott are already struggling with overdevelopment. Instead, the government should use brownfield sites, ensuring sustainable growth without destroying farmland and green spaces.
attributes.background: Stop the 1500+ house development on Bratton Farm (B5063). Prioritize brownfield sites over green spaces, protect Bratton’s rural character, and prevent overcrowded roads, schools, and services. Choose sustainable growth, not urban sprawl. Preserve our community and environment.

rejection.details:
We can’t accept petitions that request action at a local level. 

You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this. 

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP 

And you can find out how to ask your MP to present a public (paper) petition here: https://www.parliament.uk/get-involved/sign-a-petition/paper-petitions/
